website_summaries.verdict: A rugged, multi-functional toy that provides entertaining, interactive, challenging fun for your dog.
pros: Unique toy engages your dog in figuring out how to remove treats
Rugged plastic with removable twist-off top is dishwasher safe
cons: Not ideal for some very small or older dogs, but it holds up to serious play and chewing by active dogs

customer_reviews.title: It is better than the IQ balls in the sense that it ...
customer_reviews.text: My puppy went crazy for this! It is better than the IQ balls in the sense that it is not constantly getting stuck under or behind furniture because there is a weight at the bottom of it, so its hard to roll around by design. It is very sturdy. I took off one star because unlike some other food dispensers, the hole is not adjustable. Because of this, my dog was able to get all the food out within a couple minutes. Updating to 5 stars. I've had for about a year and it's the only thing I use now.
customer_reviews.author: triplebeam1988

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Our dog is weird and doesn't want to eat because he finds it boring. He will only eat when there is absolutely nothing else to do. We would have to leave food in his kennel at night because he would actually get sick from not eating. This solved that! We just put some food in it and he bobbles it throughout the house. He always eats the food that comes out and bobbles some more. This would be great for any dog that eats too quickly, as it only dispenses a few at a time. We never even need to put treats in there because he enjoys it enough to just use food.
customer_reviews.author: Amber HTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend it if you have an active dog
customer_reviews.text: My 50lbs dog destroyed the large toy in 2 days. She was able to chew around the side and broke the screw top off. I emailed KONG, I thought their products were indestructible and guaranteed but they never responded. I don't recommend it if you have an active dog.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie & Justin

customer_reviews.title: OH NO!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so UPSET!!!!! I purchased the small Wobbler for my Chihuahua about 3 days ago. Tonight, she is on her way to the emergency room. Her entire jaw and bottom of her mouth got stuck in the whole. My husband and I tried to get it off but it was literally wedged in that hole. Thank goodness I was just a few feet from her. She was screaming and wiggling. This was causing her great pain since the bottom of the Wobbler is so heavy. I managed to unscrew the bottom, heavy portion. I have attached a photo of Maxi just before she left for the emergency room.
customer_reviews.author: Observant

customer_reviews.title: Not safe at all
customer_reviews.text: Giving this one star because of the material. Thought it's made of rubber like other Kong dog toys. Chances are if a dog gets impatient taking the treats out, they will start chewing on it. Bring it made of hard plastic, I'm scared that my dog can get obstructed since she started chewing on it and the plastic starts to come off.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Wobble wobble
customer_reviews.text: This is FANTASTIC. My puppy eats way too fast and I have been feeding him with this for almost two months. It takes him 10-20 minutes to eat what he eats in 30 seconds!!! That alone is a five star rating. After some time, it looks absolutely wrecked. Deep scratches everywhere and it looks a year old already but, for functionality you cannot complain. If you don’t know it’s basically a “weebles wobble” because it won’t fall down. The bottom is weighted with sand so, it always returns upright so the pup has to constantly knock it over to get more out.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett C George

customer_reviews.title: So close to being great. Useful with mods or if the food is larger nuggets.
customer_reviews.text: The hole is way too big for my puppy kibble. So I closed it up with a bit of tape on the inside that had a small piece reversed to prevent my pup from being the Susan to my Costanza. Now it’s a little more work to get the kibble out. It doesn’t always return to upright or very quickly when it’s full of food so my pup quickly learned to roll it across the room then go back for the trail of food. Still, it takes 4-7 minutes for her to empty it which helps buy us humans time to eat our own meal unabated. So useful but could be great if Kong had made an adjustable hole.
customer_reviews.author: A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: New favorite treat toy
customer_reviews.text: I first thought wow the large might be too big, But love that it is big so my dog can’t pick up & drop like he does the rubber Kong . Cuz it’s heavy & weighted. This is an Awesome purchase!!! It’s easy to screw apart & fill. And my Boxer has pounced the hell out of it Everywhere trying to get treats out. It’s entertaining to watch but not quiet. Especially rolling on tile/wood and him slamming it against walls & cabinets. But I don’t mind that ... if you would then beware. I have other Kong’s products that you stuff . Which are great but This One gets my energetic dog moving!!!! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: M GRAU

customer_reviews.title: Kong
customer_reviews.text: I thought Kong dog toys were to be chewed on. This one comes with instructions that say, no chewing on product. They love the toy, but want to chew on it too. The other Kong toys, not so much. Great toy, except the dogs can't use it. Make this same Kong that they can chew, and I will buy it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I was very happily surprised to see my little 15 year old dachshund ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this for my 65 pound black lab. She loves eating her dinner out of it every day. However, I was very happily surprised to see my little 15 year old dachshund playing with it. He is blind and deaf but has it figured out. He is a small dog but gives it a little push with his paw and then checks the floor for any pieces that may have fallen out. I am so happy I got this. My little senior dog is getting both physical exercise and mental stimulation that he otherwise wasn't getting too much of.
customer_reviews.author: Kristaleb

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: He's very active and a recent rescue so we're still learning his quirks, but this gives him lots of entertainment. Its big enough to hold his entire meal, but I prefer to space it out because he has to work way harder for the last few pieces, which is good for keeping him busy. Its sturdy and heavy, which is nice. We've only had it a few days, but I think it will hold up well. You do want to play with it somewhere safe. Its heavy enough that it can bump and break delicate things, especially when enthusiastic dogs are knocking it around.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Jones

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: The Kong small wobbler is a wonderful treat dispensing toy for my little dog. She loves It. She figured it out quickly, but it entertains her very well and dispenses her food or treats intermittently to keep her challenged. It’s also cute to watch her with it. It is very durable to withstand scratching and biting. We do try to take it away to keep it from being overly scratched or chewed. Other brands could not hold up to her persistence and were destroyed quickly. (She’s a strong chewer.) I highly recommend this product. I was also pleased with the price, but I did order when the price was discounted a bit.
customer_reviews.author: StephanieB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: Because its so hot out I can't interest my pit bull to eat so because she likes cookies in her Kong treat ball I thought I could put kibble food in this but she's not interested because she can't toss this like the other and it doesn't seem fun for her. Can't return when used so....
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Bullmastiff-1, Kong-0.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a chewer, avoid this. Somebody else posted a picture of one with the top chewed off, I should have listened to that review. My 100 lb. Bullmastiff destroyed this thing in 20 minutes, and there were still treats inside. I think she thought it was faster than knocking the thing all over the house (which was hilarious by the way) but the laughs were not worth what we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Practical !
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for over 4 months now and our Australian Cattle Dog loves it! We use it for play, slow feeding, and calming her food aggression anxieties. It is still in great shape and if she ever looses interest in her food I mix in small amounts of treats. It's a great activity for meal times, just make sure you give your dog plenty of room! There are SLIGHT grooves on the top due to her teeth but honestly they give her a better grip to carry it away when she pleases. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Reduce dog vomit and keep your dog busy
customer_reviews.text: Works great to occupy the dog and feed dog in am and evening. Previously she would gobble down the food from a bowl...and occasionally throw up on the carpet...not a lot of fun. Takes her about 8-10 minutes to eat a cup of food...guess the kibble is the right size so not too much comes out at once. I like that the wobbler base has sand in it to deaden the wobble factor and keep it from rolling all over the place. Construction seems durable, no worries about it chewed apart like another food dispensing toy that she loved, but eventually gnawed apart like a sewer rat.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Love this product but it came so scratched up...
customer_reviews.text: This product is seriously awesome as a whole. I had one and used it religiously with my pup and then lost it. I just recieved my replacement today and it looks used it's scratched up. It will still work and there is no sense sending it back but it's ridiculous that they sent one that looked like this.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita Burke

customer_reviews.title: It’s the largest wobbler!
customer_reviews.text: This toy amazes me. I’m not sure why, but it happens to be my dogs favorite. It’s so heavy and durable but he loves opening It and taking the treat out. This particular wobbler was the largest size and I wish I would have realized that by reading the description. If there are three wobblers, they should be labeled small, medium, large....just my opinion and that’s the only reason I’ve rated it a four and not a five.....I get tired of finding the hidden measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It was ok, but poorly designed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to give my dog something to keep her mind focused, but this wobbler has a few glaring issues. One is the opening is a little too small and i had trouble finding treats that wouldn't get jammed. Sometimes my dog would knock this around for minutes and get no treats. I also noticed that occasionally the wobbler would tilt over and then get stuck on its side and wouldn't return.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My dog destroyed this after 20 mins of playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's the clown bopper for dogs
customer_reviews.text: This keeps my dog entertained for so very long. It's great. I either rip up treats or put ones tiny enough to fit in here. Sometimes his food, but he likes treats in it better. It is annoying when your dog loses interest in the treats to eat and just works to get the treats out of the toy then you're stuck wandering around the house picking up bits of dog food and snacks. But it's worth it for his joy.
customer_reviews.author: supjennifer

customer_reviews.title: MY DOG LOVES THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog figured out how to spin this to get the kibble to FLY out. I always put a couple bigger ones in there to keep her attention but now she has learned how to UNSCREW IT to get them out!!! At least it keeps her entertained while we are eating our meal. We have other feeders and switch them up but she LOVES her Kong’s! The small is perfect size for a small dog and she is not super aggressive in chewing like others that have left reviews. I do not leave her unsupervised with any toy feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Self dispensing treat toy keeps pug entertained and out of trouble
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on a tip from a obedience training class and it WORKS. Instead of chewing on the couch or tearing up pee pads, he took to it immediately. I fill it with his kibble so now he works for his meal in place of feeding from a bowl. It forces him to eat slower, keeps him entertained and out of trouble. Plus it’s super cute!
customer_reviews.author: C N

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Like everything Kong makes... this is fantastic. My 20lb puppy is almost 4 months old and goes nuts for this! Definitely recommend starting with more treats than food and helping them figure this toy out before leaving them to their own devices with it...after seeing me get treats to come out she was pretty quick to jump in and use her paws and mouth to get it moving. The Zukes mini naturals and kibble work great with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy to keep my 5 month old Lab entertained
customer_reviews.text: Perfect toy to keep my 5 month old Lab entertained. I put some of his kibble ( Science Diet large breed puppy which the kibbles are a lot bigger than other large breed puppy brands ) and I mix someto get him more excited than just the regular kibble in it. The treat hole on this is big ( just a tiny bit bigger than the size of a dime ) and if I just filled it with the small treats he would have them all out in a matter of minutes so I mix them with his kibble and it lasts him at least 30 minutes
customer_reviews.author: J. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend this product for feeding or play purposes
customer_reviews.text: This toy seriously rocks. We have a German Shepherd - Boxer mix that tears through any soft or rubber toy within minutes. Although it took a little demonstration to show him how to use it, after a month our dog still plays with this toy almost every day. The large size makes it hard for him to gnaw on it so we just have some scratch marks where he has picked it up or tried to break into the Kong. Many hours of play time has made getting things done around the house so much easier. I definitely recommend this product for feeding or play purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Drake

customer_reviews.title: My dog loved this thing so much he was playing with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not leave your dog unsupervised with this toy! My dog loved this thing so much he was playing with it before I even put food in it. Before I knew it there was a (additional) hole in the top! Now I've just got the base and can't find a replacement top. Pretty much wasted my money :(
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: delightful, sturdy , loud on wood floors - well love by the pup
customer_reviews.text: my australian cattle dog loves this -- and i love watching her interacting with it, attempting to pick it up with her jaw, pawing at it, rolling it all over my living room, looking at me pathetically when it gets stuck between the legs of a chair. my downstairs neighbor, on the other hand, probably hates it. sorry neighbor! i fill it with her kibble and sometimes it does dispense too much at a time, but it's like a little jackpot treat for her (and in the future i might try taping the hole so it's a little smaller).
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fun toy to keep them entertained and ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our dog to try and distract him while we are gone since he has separation anxiety. He loves to play with it...though wont touch it till we are back home with his anxiety. He usually leaves half his breakfast in the bowl so we just pour it in the toy and add a couple small treats. He plays with it leaving a trail of his food all over the house till all the treats are eaten and then goes back for his food lol. Good quality, fun toy to keep them entertained and much better price on amazon than retailers.
customer_reviews.author: chem

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: If you have a dog that is constantly looking for things to get into. This is the one. I wasn’t sure what size to get for my 30 pound beagle but decided to go with the large. So glad I did. She tries and tries to grab onto it but just can’t. She would have been able to with the smaller one. So she has to push it around like it’s meant to be. Just make sure if you have a determined dog that the room doesn’t have any breakables or nice furniture, or just give it outside. It’s like a roomba but not so polite.
customer_reviews.author: acf

customer_reviews.title: Not for your destroyer
customer_reviews.text: Well this lasted maybe 3 weeks with our Vizsla Lab mix before she broke through it. She's 1 and has so far destroyed everything but her Nyla bones and regular kong. So we definitely expected more from something bearing the Kong name! We are trying to find mentally challenging toys for her but she's so damn smart she figures out how to bypass the game for a quicker reward... that is, just eat through it. There were still treats in this when she finally got through.
customer_reviews.author: k. hulse

customer_reviews.title: It Entertains!!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the Kong Wobbler, it was bigger that I expected, even at a small. It took a day before my dog would even try it out. She was afraid of it. I used my foot to push it over in order to show her that it was okay to play with and that treats come out. Before long, she was pushing it around with her snout and then her paws. Now, she knows what to do. I love how durable it is. She hasn't chewed it up yet. I'll have to get bigger treats though. The small ones fly out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Latasha

customer_reviews.title: Yellow lab hasn't destroyed it yet and loves it. 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: My yellow lab manages to destroy every toy ever in life. Lately he's had high anxiety and started jumping on the counters ripping everything apart. When we would get home, we'd wall into a disaster zone, every single day. I researched dog toys that were indestructible for most dogs AND would be safe if left alone with it. So far, so good! He looooves it, we put a little peanut butter at the edge and some dog food inside. Keeps him happy for a LONG time. We come home to a normal house once again.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P

customer_reviews.title: Needs room to roam
customer_reviews.text: I got this toy so I could give my dog's food in it. I put my dog in a crate during the day and I thought this might be good entertainment. Alas, my dog didn't use it in the crate. It takes quite a bit of room for the dog to be able to push it around, so I think that was part of the problem. He will use it if it's outside of the crate, but he doesn't love it. The base is pretty heavy, but my dog can still carry it around. We don't use it much, but we've had it for several months and it still looks basically new.
customer_reviews.author: J. DavisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wobbler is a Great Way to Dispense Food
customer_reviews.text: This Kong Wobbler really helps my miniature golden doodle slow down her eating. Normally, she, like most dogs, gulps down her dry food in seconds. To help control her overeating, our vet suggested using this wobbler to slow down her consumption. It did not take her long to learn how to liberate the food. There is a single hole, your dog just needs to knock it over. Like Weebles of my childhood past, the Wobbler wobbles but doesn't fall down. This lets your dog bat it around and dispense treats or dog food. The 2 halves easily disassemble for loading and cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Great for feeding meals!
customer_reviews.text: I love feeding my dogs their meals in these!! Mental "exercise" is just as important as physical exercise for dogs, and this is a great easy way to get some of that every day. My aussie mix is just too darn smart for this sometimes - if I'm late with dinner or he's just feeling particularly stubborn, he will hold the bottom and unscrew it so he can get all the food, the little jerk! My lab mix on the other hand, still hasn't figured out he can use his paws, and knocks this all over the house with his head. It's entertainment for them and me!!
customer_reviews.author: 🌟 Emma Elizabeth 🌟

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This was a “baby present” for the very rowdy 2-year-old Lab my daughter just adopted. He loves it as much as my dogs love theirs. It slows down the pace of their eating and provides some mental stimulation in the process. It’s probably not practical for toy breeds; they’d probably have to body-slam it to tip it over. But it’s great fun for medium- to large-sized dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Marjieoc

customer_reviews.title: My dog hates eating dry food without it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog refuses to eat his dry food if its not in his kong. He loves this thing! He even carries it with him to bed occasionally. It's really helped him slow down his eating and stimulate him as well! For the first few days he was getting frustrated but now he loves it. If your dog is a chewer don't leave them unsupervised though! My dog managed to chew it up so much that he was able to open the wobbler. We had to replace it but for the few days we were waiting for the new one to arrive he was so sad that he wasnt able to play with his food!
customer_reviews.author: David Horning

customer_reviews.title: Not at all durable
customer_reviews.text: I give this product 3 stars primarily based on its durability. The plastic is hard, yet soft enough to show teeth marks after the first use. This leads to scatchy/sharp plastic pieces hanging off it. My dog clearly understands he needs to nudge it to get food out but when your only method for picking something up is with your teeth its going to take some wear. That said its no where near what Kong stands for as a company which is kind of a bummer. If your dog is even just a moderate chewer I would stay away. It hasn't proven dangerous, it just won't last nearly as long as other puzzle toys we've tried.
customer_reviews.author: CarlTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescue dog who is smart, but very timid. It takes effort on my part to help him get acquainted to changes in his environment, including fun items like this wobbler. At first, like all new things, the movement and sound of the food rolling around in the wobbler sent him running, but he warmed up to it quickly. He LOVES the wobbler! It stimulates his mind and he has fun using it.
customer_reviews.author: salvan

customer_reviews.title: If your dog eats too fast, this is a great solution
customer_reviews.text: My catahoula has very strong jaws and chews up poorly constructed toys. She has issues with eating too fast and keeping her engaged so this is perfect. We mix her foods and giver her half to eat immediately. A half hour later we give her the Kong to play with, slowing down her eating the second half of her dinner and keep her engaged while she manipulates it to get the food out.
customer_reviews.author: Da Bear In Tx

customer_reviews.title: durable and useful
customer_reviews.text: I feed all my dog's meals through this kong. It keeps him busy and makes him work for this meals. I like that it provides some stimulation for him during meal time. It took him a few minutes to understand how it works but was able to figure it out. I bought two thinking he will destroy them quickly (he is a heavy chewer) but the first one is still being used, it only has your basic wear and tear of scratches and some bites. Very durable, I recommend for the strong chewers.
customer_reviews.author: m.i.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME product!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My doggy loves it and it ensures he doesn’t gulp his food down. I use it for his feedings and for treats. The video is his first experience with it, and now he pushes it around playfully all the time! Sometimes I sprinkle a little shredded cheese over his dog food inside and he goes nuts for it!! The shredded cheese comes out with the kibble. LOVE this product. Very sturdy too! Small size in the video.
customer_reviews.author: JaneOPks

customer_reviews.title: A must-buy for any rough playing dog
customer_reviews.text: I gave this wobbler to my 7 month old golden lab mixes who are rough players. So far, they're loving it. It's holding up very well against rough, frequent handling. The dogs love how it's unpredictable. I love how it's weighted and they can't pick it up or wrap their jaws around it long enough to chew on it. It's the perfect amount mental stimulation and I am so glad I bought this. I would recommend this for anyone looking for an interactive, durable toy for their rough-playing dogs. This is by far my favorite toy from this company so far.
customer_reviews.author: book geek

customer_reviews.title: Can make hole smaller
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old puppy and my 7 year old dog (both Havanese, small dogs) love getting dry food out of this kind-of-big-Kong toy. The puppy immediately made the toy wobble to get the food out. Then the older dog joined in. The food came out too easy at first, and I didn't want to put too much food in it, just enough to finish off a meal for them. So I put some duct tape on the inside to make the hole smaller, and the treats took longer for the dogs to get them out. They seem to really enjoy playing with this Kong toy.
customer_reviews.author: vdfrddddi

customer_reviews.title: Good but not super challenging
customer_reviews.text: I got this as another food puzzle for my bully mix, and it holds up great to his need to carry and chew things, but the hole for the food to come out of is big, and he can empty it in 10 minutes max. I wish the hole was adjustable to make it a bit more challenging. It rolls easily across carpet though, even my cat enjoys it!
customer_reviews.author: Lizza

customer_reviews.title: Good for our small terrier
customer_reviews.text: I use this to feed our high energy terrier for just a little extra play time. He ca be lazy about working for his food, but for the most part he loves this little toy. He's very small (only about 11lbs) but he has no issue bopping the 5 inch size around with his nose and paws. We wash ours by hand and it's very easy to clean. Overall, very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to feed your dog!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality, large wobbler. It took only one feeding/play lesson for our dog to figure out how to use this on his own. He loves to play with it. He enjoys being busy. We use it for his food, because we feed him 3 times a day. It is only messy when you get down to the bottom of the food bag where it's crumby. At that point we only use his bowl to feed him. He also has 3 other treat toys that he bounces around with treats in them. This one wobbles. We love watching him! We also like that it is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: B + D Heusmann

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive treat/food dispenser - keep those little brains busy and out of trouble.
customer_reviews.text: Great interactive treat/food dispenser to keep your pup busy. Holds 1/2c food or treats, fun and durable (at least so far). I have a tenacious chewer so I watch her closely and no damage in the past 2 days. Use only with supervision. Keeps her little brain busy and out of trouble. It’s also great for the fast eater and an option to the slow-feeder dish. However, it does create a bit of a mess on your floor/carpet so just be advised. This was recommended by a Social Behavioralist and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Mnnance

customer_reviews.title: Old dachund turned puppy again
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Kong Wobbler for our sedentary dachshund in hopes she would be encouraged to move around more during the day. It turned out to be an excellent toy for her. We began with treats, and her response was so positive that we now also feed her with it. It's a great alternative to a slow-feed dog bowl. Aprox times: 20 min to remove all kibble, 1.5 hours to get various sized treats out. Perhaps the best feature is the unscrewable top, which allows it to be cleaned in the dishwasher. We can give her squishy treats that would otherwise be impossible to clean out. It's worth noting that she has batted it around when it is empty too.
customer_reviews.author: Viking Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Small size is bigger than expected, works great though
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the small for my two dogs, one is a 6 lb. Chihuahua puppy and the other a 18 pound senior Chihuahua mix. I was surprised that the small was so big but it hasn't stopped either from playing with it and getting the treats out just fine. I actually like the size for them because it takes them a little more effort to push it around. It is built very well and seems like it will be durable and hold up over time like their other similar Kong toys have.
customer_reviews.author: OlyNomad

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted two high energy hounds and I'm desperately trying to find things to keep them occupied. This looked challenging but the bottom is shallow so the kibble is not as far from the hole as I anticipated. They jammed it under a shelf and emptied it in 5 minutes, and then one started chewing on it like a bone. By the time I stopped him - which was really fast - he'd gouged out, so I think this goes in a drawer to be forgotten :(. Not sufficiently challenging for smart, driven dogs.
customer_reviews.author: thebeta99Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us....
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this toy given that it is Kong brand. I either got a defective one or my dog has super dog power jaws. Despite the toy being screwed together completely, he somehow within minutes managed to pop it open and then proceeded to chew the bottom portion of the toy so as that it no longer goes back together. And he did this all within about 5 minutes while I stepped out of the room. I would expect a little more durability from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Heather T.

customer_reviews.title: Engaging, Indestructible Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you, Kong folks! This toy is great. Presents a fun challenge for our little chewy Charlie. When he's bored, he chews anything he can get his terrier/chihuahua jaws on. This toy is indestructible and fascinating. As the old toy commercial went: It weebles, it wobbles, it never falls over. Put treats or a bell inside and it will engage puppy for a good while. Often pops back and bops him in the head, which only increases the challenge. Highest praise for the Wobbler.
customer_reviews.author: Fran S.

customer_reviews.title: Best dog product on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best dog product on the market! Helped slow our puppies eating which helped regulate is digestive system and properly absorb the nutrients needed. Easy to travel with! Makes your dog work a little for food. Mentally stimulating. It can be a bit noisy on hardwood floors or hard surfaces but that only lasts as long as it takes your dog to finish (10-13min at most). Ultimately, you shouldn’t let a few minutes of a noisy plastic ball spilling food out onto the floor deter you from purchasing this durable, quality product. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.author: imlynam

customer_reviews.title: Great product, idiot dog
customer_reviews.text: I like it - product was exactly as I expected and works perfectly fine. The problem is that my less-than-intelligent dog refuses to play with it. She just stares at it expecting something to happen. I have showed her (with her own paws and nose) how to knock food out of it and she still doesn't get it. I mean she still eats the food when it comes out, but uses no effort to get it herself. That's why I gave it 4 stars - it may not work on every dog, but if your dog is smarter than mine, you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: blong

customer_reviews.title: Lab proof!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my fury niece, who is a 9 month old yellow lab. And my brother kinda chuckled and said "I can usually give a toy a time frame in which it will be destroyed!" But he was unable to with this one!! He sent me a picture and it showed a defeated lab with a new favorite toy! So far they have claimed this toy "lab proof" I will follow up if the status ever changes!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Mama

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My dog is spoiled. He got this for his first birthday and I debated whether or not to get him ANOTHER toy. I'm glad I did tho. I would honestly trade half of all his toys for this one. It keeps him so busy and he love it. I did put a piece of tape over 1/4 of the hole to slow down the dispense of food. Also for size reference, he's a 25# rat terrier and this size is perfect. He likes to chew everything so the bigger size keeps him from picking it up and chewing it (tho he tries) and it keeps it from getting lost under the sofa.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Fun for dogs, mental stimulation, durable
customer_reviews.text: My border collie loves this. I get sick sometimes and can’t take her walking as much, so I load this and her purple saucer toy and it gives her mental stimulation. It can be noisy as it gets banged around, but it’s fun to watch her figure it out. Sometimes it gets stuck under furniture and she barks for me to come rescue it for her until she knocks it under something else. She gets excited when she sees me pick it up. Also, it’s great for slowing down fast eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck dog toy
customer_reviews.text: Out of a bucket of like 20-30 dog toys, this one is #2 in terms of usage, right behind our dog’s cuddle toy she grew up with and takes everywhere. We free feed so she is a picky eater who often turns her nose at kibble in the bowl, but kibble in this toy is somehow INTERESTING and worth eating. She’ll often work up an appetite then move on to the bowl. Great design. Dog loves it.
customer_reviews.author: bliss

customer_reviews.title: Cute Idea for non-lazy dogs!
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great! It bounces around and your dog can box it until a treat comes out. I have a min poodle and shih tzu. Both who are too spoiled to work for their treats. The shih tzu was more successful than the poodle. I had a blast video taping them try. I had to hit it a few times to remind them food was in there. I left it with them full of food and came home to it untouched. Overall, wasn't as effective for my pups, but I think it would be for more adventurous dogs who are not lazy! :)
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Fun food dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! I try to give my dog all of her kibble in toys, and most of them are just homemade out of old waterbottles, etc (which get destroyed within 12 hours to about a week usually). Sure, this is a little scratched up, but I've got a 70+ lb rotty/shepherd mix, so the fact that it's lasted three months is INCREDIBLE. It definitely took some practice for her to get the hang of it but now she loves it! It's true that her initial reaction was to just pick it up and carry it around, but after a few days she got the hang of just knocking it over.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: Soooo much better than the old rubber Kong! He's not a chewer but he's a treat hog! He loved the old one (it's lasted 15 years and served a Rottweiler before my Dane) but I could never get the peanut butter cleaned out of it. This will be much easier to clean! Don't get it as a chew toy- the hard plastic isn't made for that. I filled it with a mixture of kibble and chopped up chicken jerky. My boy seems to prefer the chicken, so there's kibble all over the floor! I'm glad he likes it. Merry Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: KarinF

customer_reviews.title: Lab Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My lab loves this toy, and so do I. I was looking for something to keep his mind occupied, especially during the winter when he is indoors more than usual and this Kong Wobbler is perfect. I use it to give him his breakfast and add a few small treats in there to make it even more motivating. He chases it around and carries it around. It is easy to get the food out so it keeps his interest and when it runs out, I just refill it. Great for keeping him busy and out of trouble!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: So happy that I purchased this...
customer_reviews.text: This came recommended by a personal trainer. My rescue pup eats his food quickly and then tries to eat the other pet's food, or the furniture. This keeps him engaged for several minutes giving us all time to do what we need to do. :-) Very happy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So great!
customer_reviews.text: My sheltie gets most of her meals out of this! It slows her down and makes her work for it a little bit and she LOVES it! We've had it for over a year and besides having a few scratches it is in great condition. Holds all of her food for one meal with extra room left over and doesn't let it all come out at once. It probably takes her close to 5-10ish minutes to finish her food most days. Much better than the 15 seconds it takes her to eat out of a bowl!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Came apart after a couple of days.
customer_reviews.text: It broke after only a week. The top came away from the weighted bottom. This exposed the sand used for weighting the toy so it would wobble. Fortunately I caught it before I had the sand all over the house. Before it came apart, our puppy enjoyed playing with it, and if she had used it longer, she probably would have loved it. It is plastic, not rubber like the traditional Kong we use to fill with a little peanut butter and put in the freezer. The shape is the same, but the toy isn't
customer_reviews.author: Grammie Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to keep a dog busy and happy!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved this!!!! He figures out puzzles quickly when there is food involved. I put some food inside along with one treat. This occupied him for about 30 minutes and after that he started whining because he got everything out except for the treat. I imagine this will get easier for him as time goes on. One thing to consider is the size/shape of the treat you put inside. It may seem like common sense, but the treat I put in there was just slightly bigger than the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Miller

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining but not made for dogs with teeth
customer_reviews.text: Took my Borzoi 15 minutes to eat his meal. Kept him engaged and occupied as well as prevented him from gobbling down his kibble. Sadly, this product is made out of plastic and not out of the robust rubber material regular Kong’s are made of. Even though I supervised my dogs interaction with this item, this thing got really torn up. Unless you have a toothless dog, I can not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja B.

customer_reviews.title: good quality. Large size is really large.
customer_reviews.text: This Large size is so huge. I should buy a smaller size for my golden retriever pup. I put small treats and kibble in this wobbler. my dogs can play with it for a very long time as long as the treats keep coming out. this product is made of thick plastic, not rubber. I do see some teeth scratches on it after my dog played with it. If your dog is a biter, this may not last long. btw, the crumb comes out with treats/kibble, you may want to limit the space where you dog can play with it.
customer_reviews.author: ❀ Simba & Maria ❀ ジュリア・キャメロンTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Weebles wobble! & the treats pop out!
customer_reviews.text: Only gave 3 stars on sturdiness because its not supposed to be sturdy. Lol. My dog loves this thing. Hes always begging for treats. So now he literally has to work for then. The company that shipped this product was AMAZING when it got lost through the mail. Quick and supportive customer service.
customer_reviews.author: jordan badgley

customer_reviews.title: My dog can play with this for hours
customer_reviews.text: My high-energy dog absolutely loved this! It is pretty durable (although he did chew it up on the side trying to get the food out before he figured out how to use it). The small is pretty large, and holds about a cup of food. My other, much smaller dog can barely use it (or maybe he just doesn't want to, lol). Unless you have a Great Dane or other large breed, go with the small. You can throw it in the dishwasher when you're done, which makes this one of the cleanest dog toys ever!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to slow down a fast eater
customer_reviews.text: My dog tends to be ravenous when it comes to his food - in fact, half the time he doesn't even bother to chew! When I first adopted him, I put his dry food in a bowl and he would inhale it all in the time it took me to turn around. I now use the wobbler to feed him dinner every day, and while didn't understand it at first (poor guy seemed to have never seen a toy before), he was patient and he eventually got the hang of it. Now he absolutely loves it and it forces him to eat more slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine KingTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Shreds easily - plastic not rubber - not safe for my pup
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 month old puppy enjoyed it for less than a day, before he started shredding the plastic top. Small plastic bits came off and were ingested by him. I was very surprised that the Kong Wobbler is made of a hard plastic, not the type of rubbery material that other Kongs are made from. Our pup has not destroyed the other type - we've had two of the traditional type for over three months. I assumed the Kong Wobbler would be the same material, but it was not. The Kong Wobbler was in the garbage after a day, so was a waste of money, and a danger. Too bad, as our dog loved it as a toy/food dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B Boreth

customer_reviews.title: Dog could not destruct it
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. We now have it for our big dogs and small dogs and they keep them busy for quite a while. It's nice to see the 6 months old puppy figuring it out and then going to take a nap bc he is mentally tired. Our Lab has not been able to destroy it like he has done with so many other toys, including other KONG products. It's been several months since we got it for him and it is still wobbling!!!
customer_reviews.author: Trooper_the_Snooper

customer_reviews.title: your dog will thank you
customer_reviews.text: When our Siberian Husky was a puppy, we had a dog trainer come work with us and with him. She highly suggested the Wobbler to keep him busy and engaged, as these dogs are so smart and become so easily bored. We (as in, the people and the dog) freaking love this thing. We (as in, the people) load it up with treats and sometimes even just DOG FOOD. His own darned dog food. He (as in, the dog) cannot get enough of it. It's a fun "party trick" to show visitors as well. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Susan P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Pros - heavy duty build and holds a lot of treats. Cons - very poor design on the opening. You can put a 1/4 cup of treats in it and half the treats will come out the first time the dog tilts it. The "door" need to be adjustable. Have ordered a different version that has an adjustable opening and will junk this one. Recommend buying one with an adjustable opening for different sized treats and flow rate. Only reason for two stars is that it is ruggedly built and hold lots of treats otherwise it is a one star toy.
customer_reviews.author: F. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Durable, fun, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is well made - durable and easy to clean. My dog loves batting it around and even manages to carry it from place to place even though he's just over 20 lbs. I've had it a long time and it barely has a scratch on it. One thing I will mention is since the base is weighted, my dog can't tell when it's empty and gets frustrated when the treats stop coming out. He's learned to bring it to me and I open it up and show him it's all gone. :)
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and practical
customer_reviews.text: This is great. My dog loves it. It's so funny watching her retrieve her food that we kept re-filling it and she gained weight. Now I use it for her regular meal of dry food. It is a good solution for dogs that eat too fast. The price is high for a dog toy, but it is worth a stretch for what it does. I bought a small Wobbler for a friend's Pomeranians.
customer_reviews.author: CeM

customer_reviews.title: but once he did it was awesome to watch him get his treats
customer_reviews.text: It took our Beagle a few days to really figure this thing out, but once he did it was awesome to watch him get his treats. Be warned this Kong will end up in corners of the house you did not know you had, I would literally need to search for it after he had pushed this Kong all over the house. Beagle lost 6lbs in 6 weeks, on a new diet and having to work for his treats. We would put a small portion of his daily kibble in here when grand daughter was visiting and she would laugh and follow the dog for the entire time he was getting fed, both of them have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I first just used this for treats, but now I use it to give my dog all his food. While I can't know for sure whether he actually "likes" the wobbler, it keeps him occupied, it's adorable to watch him use it, and I like to think it's at least a little bit of intellectual stimulation for him. The only con I can think of is that it can make a racket as he bumps it around, but I actually like that I can hear him using it. He'll also sometimes bump it under something, so I'm often fetching it for him out from under a couch.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: My dog gives it 2 thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month golden retriever loves this thing. It is taller than I expected. It primarily stands up on the floor about 8 inches. You unscrew the bottom portion of it and add smaller treats (like food pellets), then screw it together. The dog needs to tip it over to have the treats come out. My dog loves this but the only knock...I will need to get larger treats to make it slightly more challenging to dispense the treats.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Pup Loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a large sized Kong for my German Shepard Pup, he loves it. I got the bigger one so he can use it as he grows up. Science diet kibble is perfectly sized for this. Adding about 1/3rd of his meal to the Kong really keeps him busy for awhile. It did not take him long to figure out, and takes him about 25 minutes to eat 1 cup.
customer_reviews.author: Athenah

customer_reviews.title: Great way to entertain your dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is challenging for dogs but not boring. You can put their breakfast of dry kibble in there and they will be occupied all morning. I also like it as a way of slowing down my dog who literally swallows his food whole when eating. So it works as a toy and prevents my dog from eating to fast and getting sick. Great product that is made of durable material.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S. Link

customer_reviews.title: My 13 week old puppy loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Our 13 week old Cockapoo lives this thing! At first she was skeptical, but I played it and her for about 30 minutes. Next day another 30 minutes. In day three we heard some noise from the Kong. We looked over and there she was...totally figuring it out. We are in day 4 and she entertains herself trying to get her regular puppy food out of it. Very happy with this purchase. I accidentally ordered the large and it is way too big for a five pound dog. She'll grow into the small one. Thug life.
customer_reviews.author: Invader

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: My super energetic, super strong chewer loves this! It's just big enough that he can't get his entire mouth around it long enough to chew a hole into it! The first time I gave it to him he was obsessed with it (video included), although now (third time) he's figured it out and gets his entire meal out within five minutes but he's still enjoying it. The only con, in my opinion, is that the food hole is a little too big - he'll get out like ten pieces each time he knocks it over
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine & Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Entertainment for dog and human
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this so much! She typically only goes for plushy toys that she destroys in minutes, but she instantly took to the Wobbler. It's a riot watching her smack this around and chase the kibble across the floor. I put it out for her every day when I go to work and she hasn't gotten bored of it yet. She is a 60 lb lab-pit mix and this was a good size for her. The top is juuuust small enough that she can pick up the toy sometimes but she can't do any real damage to it.
customer_reviews.author: Allie D

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My girl loves batting this around to spill out her food. She a 65-pound German Shepherd/Doberman/Rottweiler mix and it didn't take her long to figure out what to do with this wobbler. I put her dinner kibble in it nearly every night and she has fun knocking it around. She gets real excited as I fill it and barely gives me time to set it down before attacking it. She's seems disappointed when the food stops coming out and will stare at it for a while until I put it away.
customer_reviews.author: Holly's Mama

customer_reviews.title: SOLID!
customer_reviews.text: My dog can chew anything up... Rocks, cardboard, walk lights, water bowls ( both metal and plastic), dog houses,blankets, shoes, sweatshirts, mattresses, trash, toys, did I mention rocks?! Anyway he is chewer. So far he hasn't destroyed this. Its been a month now. I fill it with extra dog dog food to keep him entertained so he doesn't chew on the above mentioned items. Solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Gossard

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love to play with it.
customer_reviews.text: My big 110 lb dobe and my 30 pound terrier both enjoy playing with this toy and go at it for a while as long as I keep refilling it with snacks. Make sure their healthy otherwise they're sure to get overweight if you keep giving them treats. I've had this for 6 years now and we'll pull it out for them to play with now and again and they have always had fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Magnate

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty great
customer_reviews.text: Another big win from Kong. The classic Kong (with frozen treats inside) keeps our pup busy for a while (instead of inhaling his meals). And this guy keeps him busy for a while between meals with snacks. He got mildly frustrated as he was learning how to get the gold, but he's VERY food driven (like most puppies) so he kept at it. Key is finding the perfect size treat to match how long you want this "game" to last.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Standard Poodle 9 months old loves this (well, I think he does) he has gouged it up quite a bit aaaaand it collects fuzz from our rug and the floor but that isn’t the problem of the item I put a 3rd of our dogs daily food in this contraption and leave it in the living room for him he truly seems engaged and perky when he is pushing it around and eating what falls out we are pleased (video of dog in one place but usually he bats it around the room)
customer_reviews.author: W&V

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog literally plays with this toy EVERY DAY! She has yet to get bored with it. She also is a picky eater. The toy makes mealtime more interesting and she is more inclined to eat now! Totally worth the money! The wobbler is also very durable and has yet to have any issues of wear after daily play. Totally recommend this toy!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great for big dogs, but don't let them chew it. Pick it up after the treats are gone!
customer_reviews.text: We foster dogs and this is a sturdy product, but it takes a bigger dog to knock it over enough to get the treats out, and we let a dog chew on it after they were gone....picture says it all. The smaller dogs couldn't knock it over and got bored and frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Always better at the beach

customer_reviews.title: Dogs will love it... you might hate the sound
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a BIG fan of the Wobbler and so am I. The only downside is if you have wood flooring, then you get to hear every single hit and bump this thing makes as your dog tries to get every last treat out. I would say to make sure you keep everything you put in there relatively small, otherwise you run the risk of the hole getting jammed and you'll have a frustrated pup on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after the bob-a-lot or whatever was not durable enough for my heavy chewer. Unfortunately this is made out of similar material. It is not made out of rubber, but hard plastic, so my dog was still able to chew it up and create sharp indentations which would cut her mouth if I were to let her chew on it. This would probably work if your dogs mouth is not large enough to get around it or it your dog is simply not a heavy chewer. But if your dog tends to chew everything that isn't made of heavy duty rubber into pieces, I would not recommend this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not just entertaining for dogs but also for people too :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to entertain my little pup but I didn't expect how entertaining it would be to watch her figure it out. I have almost 10 minutes of video of her swatting the Kong, nudging it with her nose, licking the little treat dispenser hole and barking at it. It's very durable and easy to use. I think I need to get bigger or more irregular shaped treats so they don't fall out so easily but I love this! So glad I got this for her!
customer_reviews.author: BonnieB

customer_reviews.title: Good 'keep busy' toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. (Leave is to Kong!) The large is QUITE large--much too big for my Australian shepherd to pick up. Good design and quality; easy to use. I was afraid my dog's small kibble would just fall right out, but the design keeps it to a slow trickle. This gives my Aussie something extra to do at mealtime; it takes him 10-15 minutes to get his cup of food out of the toy. The only drawbacks I've noticed are some noise on hardwood floors and a tendency to go under furniture. But we've enjoyed this.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Keeps a Sammie Busy
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy! He's a Sammie, and loves batting things with his paws. I was worried the hole would be too big, as some reviewers mentioned, but it's fine for the size of dog food we get. Or at least, how our dog plays with it. He seems more inclined to eat when he had to bat out the food first. It's easy to take apart and put back together, and it is weighted down with sand, basically asking like a Weebil, only it does lay on its side at times. That's alright though, dog just rolls it around and flips it back up.
customer_reviews.author: A. KoubaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but moves around a lot on hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: My 70 lb American bulldog puppy loves this toy. At first he wasn't quite sure what to do with it, but he caught on right away once I had him eat his breakfast from the toy. I'm glad I went with the large size, because it makes it difficult for him to pick up and chew the toy. I just wish the base was heavier, though. I have hardwood floors and the toy scoots around throughout the room, getting trapped in corners, leaving TONS of kibble under every piece of furniture. It would love to use it daily if it didn't leave kibble hidden everywhere for me to clean up later.
customer_reviews.author: Kiiks

product_meta.title: KONG - Wobbler - Interactive Treat Dispensing Dog Toy, Dishwasher Safe - Large
product_meta.description: The KONG-shaped Wobbler is an action-packed treat and food dispensing toy. It sits upright until pushed by a dog’s paw or nose and then periodically dispenses tasty rewards as it wobbles, spins and rolls. The unpredictable movement keeps the toy challenging, even for seasoned Wobbler users. The Wobbler can also be used as an alternative to a dog bowl to help slow and extend mealtime while providing exercise for your dog. Unscrews for easy filling and cleaning. Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.
feature_bullets: Dispenses food and treats for hours of fun; prevents rapid eating
Measures 7 x 6 x 10.5-inches; suitable for dogs weighing 25-pounds or more

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
